articleContent.title: Chord: Diminished 7th in G (Shape: G)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: Diminished 7th in G (Shape: G)

## Brief Presentation
The Diminished 7th chord is known for its dissonant and tense sound. It is made up of a diminished triad (root, minor third, diminished fifth) with the added note of a diminished 7th. In the key of G, the G Diminished 7th chord consists of the notes G, Bb, Db, and Fb (which is enharmonically equivalent to E). This chord creates a sense of suspense and can be used to add tension in compositions.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root: G
- Minor 3rd: Bb
- Diminished 5th: Db
- Diminished 7th: Fb (Enharmonically E)

## Musical Flavor and Genre
The Diminished 7th chord is commonly used in jazz and classical music to add color and dissonance to compositions. It is often used as a passing chord or to create tension that resolves to a more stable chord. This chord is associated with a sense of mystery and unease due to its dissonant intervals.

## Songs
1. "All the Things You Are" by Jerome Kern
2. "Blue Monk" by Thelonious Monk
3. "Eleanor Rigby" by The Beatles
